Stem: Square shaped in cross section, mostly hairless, green to purplish.
Leaves: Oppositely arranged in variable shape from oval to compound of 3-7 leaflets. Have toothed edges.
Flowers: Compound of numerous yellow tubular flowers in a small head 5-15 mm across. Sometimes have white petals around the flowerhead.
FruitSeeds: Dark brown or black seeds which are elongated and have barbed awns which are easily caught in clothing.
Habitat: Roadsides, grasslands, shrublands, riparian areas, coastal scrub, disturbed areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Distinguished from other Beggarticks (*Bidens* species) by elongated burr-like fruits which stick in clothing.
